intro: Stisseria hispidula, commonly known as the hairy stisseria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
